page.title: 01Gazetteer: Nidderdale
page.content:
This is a rural area which comprises mainly of farm land. The land is used for the rearing of beef cattle and sheep, and for the growing of silage. The river Nidd runs through the valley which is formed by gentle hills. On the east bank is the small market town of Pateley Bridge and on the opposite bank is the attractive village of Bridgehousegate. There is a very interesting selection of footpaths and a variety of woodland. There are several old quarries and springs scattered throughout the area. Most buildings here are constructed from local stone.
Bewerley Park Bridgehousegate (village) Heathfield, Wath (hamlets) Pateley Bridge (market town) Nidd (river)
